# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is Julia's code for your problem:
```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    wrapped_text = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "$line\n"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    return wrapped_text * line
end
```
This function splits the input string into words, checks if adding a new word to an existing line would exceed the specified width. If it does, it appends the current line to `wrapped_text` and starts a new line. At the end of all lines are concatenated with the last one (if any words were left).

Let's use this function to wrap some text:
```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit"
println(wrap_string(text))
```
This will output:
```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit
amet, 
consectetur 
adipiscing 
elit
```
